Posts.Content: annyo wrote: At our local breast center, there is some controversy about whether a surgeon should be involved in a woman's case prior to any biopsy.  In view of the fact that over 80% of biopsies have a negative result, what is your opinion on the following question:  After having a workup which indicates a need for biopsy, would you prefer to have, after consultation with a breast navigator/advisor, the option of having a biopsy done as soon as possible (same day or in the time span of your choice) or would you prefer to be required to schedule a consultation with a surgeon prior to biopsy?  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Need your opinions... annyo snowiecal
